job title: DATA SCIENTIST in Portland, Oregon location Contract to Hire
job description:
Skills Required:
  • 5+ years experience in advanced analytics and machine learning model development and validation.
  • 3+ years experience working in industry, leading analytic-based projects, and delivering results within scope, funding, and duration.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required to convey advanced statistical concepts to all levels of employees. Data visualization skills are required.
  • Strong problem solving skills with a drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
  • Strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods.
  • Advanced experience with Python or R.
  • Experience using statistical software (SAS, SPSS, etc.).
  • Experience using analytics reporting software like Spotfire, Tableau, Excel, etc.
  • Experience with SQL Server databases, T-SQL queries and ETL. Familiarity with Hadoop and Hive is desired.
  • Knowledge of the following concepts:
    • Data transformations (e.g. log transformation, standardization, normalization)
    • Univariate and Multivariate tests (e.g. t-test, non-parametric rank tests, ANOVA, MANOVA, ANCOVA, regression)
    • Statistical modeling (e.g. linear regression, generalized linear models, multivariate regression, ARIMA models, classical time series decomposition, mixed models)
    • Clustering (e.g. k-means, hierarchical clustering, Gaussian mixtures)
    • Dimensionality reduction (e.g. Principle Components Analysis, Discrete Fourier transform, Wavelets)
    • Classification (e.g. logistic regression, Support Vector Machine, neural networks, K-NN, na ve Bayes, decision trees)
    • Optimization concepts (e.g. boosting and bagging)
  • Leverage Big Data to discover patterns and solve strategic and tactical business problems using massive structured and unstructured data sets across multiple environments.
  • Familiarity with shifting products from an OnPrem to SaaS model
  • Working knowledge of SDLC including Agile methodologies
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward task completion
  • Demonstrated effective leadership and analytical skills
  • Smart, driven and problem solver
  • Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to prioritize
  • Ability to perform well under pressure in a fast-paced environment with a high sense of urgency.
  • Completion of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution that prepares the employee for the assignment.
  • Preferred Graduate degree in data science, machine learning, mathematics, statistics, or related discipline.
Healthcare experience preferred
